gsw_content_information.article:
A search profile stores all settings for a specific search experience. These include search sources, dictionaries for synonyms and stop words, typo handling dictionary settings, and Genius Result configurations. Create and publish a search profile for each search experience you want to offer in a Now Platform search application.
  1. Review the default search profile by following these steps.
    1. Edit the search profile.
    2. Examine the settings on the Search Profile form and each of its related lists.
    3. Return to the search profile list by clicking the Back icon.
  2. Optionally, define and publish new search profiles as needed for your AI Search implementation by following these steps.
    1. Click New.
    2. On the Search Profile form, fill in the fields.
      Label
      Unique label for the search profile.
      Description
      Notes on configuration or usage of the search profile.
    3. Click Submit.
    4. Edit the new search profile.
    5. Click Publish.
  3. If you created new search profiles, link search sources to them by following these steps.
    1. Edit the search profile that you want to link a search source to.
    2. In the Search Sources related list, click Link Existing.
    3. On the Search Profile - Search Source Mapping form, select the search source that you want to link to the search profile, then click Submit.
    4. Repeat these steps for each additional search source you want to link to the search profile.
gsw_content_information.title: Define search profiles
